location.title: Bute Building
location.description:
This Grade II listed neoclassical building was designed by architects Percy Thomas and Ivor Jones, who won a competition in 1911 to design a building for Cardiff Technical College. The foundations of the building were laid in 1913 and the building opened in 1916. There are six Roman Doric columns in the front of the building.

programs.title: Studying Economics at Cardiff Business School
programs.description:
Find out more about studying Economics at Cardiff University: an overview of the entry requirements, course content and structure.

Due to the very recent revalidation of our Economics degree programmes, we wanted to make you aware of entry requirement changes which will affect the following programmes: Banking and Finance, Banking and Finance with a Professional Placement Year, Business Economics, Business Economics with a Professional Placement Year, Economics and Economics with a Professional Placement Year. For September 2025 entry onwards, all of the above programmes will require A-level Mathematics at a grade B or above. Students not taking A-level Mathematics will not be eligible for entry onto these programmes.
programs.description_short: Learn more about studying Economics at Cardiff University.

location.title: Main Building (Park Place)
location.description:
Main Building - Architect W.D. Caroe sought to combine the charm and elegance of his former college (Trinity College, Cambridge) with the picturesque balance of many of the University of Oxford colleges. Building work on the Main Building commenced in 1905 and was completed in many stages, the first in 1909. Money ran short for this project, however, and although the side-wings were completed in the 1960s the planned Great Hall has never been built.

location.title: Abacws Building
location.description:
Accessibility information

There is level access into Abacws from Senghennydd Road through the main entrance, and also from the rear of the building behind Cathays train station.

The lifts service all floors. Each lift has a mirror at the back and the levels are both audio and visually indicated.

There are two accessible cubicles on each floor. These are adjacent to each set of toilets.

Baby changing facilities are available in the Toilet for All on the ground floor.

Parking

There is street parking along Senghennydd Road, where blue badge holders can park free of charge.

Bicycle Parking

There are also freely available bicycle racks to the rear of the building next to the Cathays railway station ticket office.

Water refill locations:

2nd floor - North corridor
2nd floor - South corridor
3rd floor - North corridor
3rd floor - South corridor
4th floor - South corridor
5th floor - North corridor

topics.name: Dentistry and Dental Therapy and Hygiene
topics.description: Your clinical skills will be developed in the School’s refurbished £2.2m clinical skills laboratory, a facility that closely simulates the real clinical experience.

programs.title: Come and talk to our academics, admissions staff and current students about the programmes offered by the School of Dentistry
programs.description: Come and talk to our academics and admissions staff about the programmes offered by the School of Dentistry. Current students will be on hand to answer your questions about life as a student in the School of Dentistry. This session will be available throughout the day. Come and say hello!
programs.description_short: Find out about the programmes offered by the School of Dentistry.
programs.room: Centre for Student Life, Cathays Park Campus

location.title: Centre for Student Life
location.description:
The Centre for Student Life is a service-led project delivered in partnership with the Students’ Union and is part of the biggest campus upgrade in a generation. It is the fruition of a successful and dynamic partnership that the University is proud to enjoy with its student body.

The new building is home to the University's Student Life services including support with study, health and wellbeing, preparing for the future, managing money and living in Cardiff. It will also increase links with the Students’ Union and enhance the services already provided there.

programs.title: Demonstrations and virtual tour of the School of Dentistry
programs.description: There will be demonstrations allowing you to experience assessing teeth on a phantom head, to practise your manual dexterity skills, and an introduction to some materials that are used in dentistry. You will also be able to view a virtual video tour of the School of Dentistry. This session will be available throughout the day.
programs.description_short: Demonstrations and virtual tour of the School of Dentistry.
programs.room: Centre for Student Life, Cathays Park Campus

location.title: Centre for Student Life
location.description:
The Centre for Student Life is a service-led project delivered in partnership with the Students’ Union and is part of the biggest campus upgrade in a generation. It is the fruition of a successful and dynamic partnership that the University is proud to enjoy with its student body.

The new building is home to the University's Student Life services including support with study, health and wellbeing, preparing for the future, managing money and living in Cardiff. It will also increase links with the Students’ Union and enhance the services already provided there.

programs.title: Guided Tour of the Heath Park Campus
programs.description: Come on a guided tour of the Heath Park Campus to see some of the general facilities available to our students. Unfortunately, it will not be possible for guests to visit inside the Dental School itself on Saturdays. Our Heath Park Campus is home to three academic schools offering programmes in medicine, dentistry and healthcare sciences. Co-located with the 1,000 bed University Hospital of Wales - the third largest teaching hospital in the UK - our students are immersed in a hospital environment. Last tour departs at 15:15. Don't forget to allow extra time to travel to activities at the Heath Park Campus. See information on our shuttle bus routes in the 'Getting around the University' section on the main page of the app.
programs.description_short: Guided tour of the Heath Park Campus to see some of the general facilities. Unfortunately, it will not be possible for guests to visit inside the Dental School itself on Saturdays.
programs.room: Guided tours depart from the Welcome Marquee at the Heath Park Campus

programs.title: Why Study at Cardiff University?
programs.description: As Wales' only Russell Group university, Cardiff University has much to offer. From research excellence and on-going campus investment, to our capital city location and active Students' Union. This talk will cover what makes Cardiff University such an exciting place to study.
programs.description_short: This talk will cover what makes Cardiff University such an exciting place to study.
programs.room: Sir Stanley Thomas OBE Lecture Theatre

location.title: Centre for Student Life
location.description:
The Centre for Student Life is a service-led project delivered in partnership with the Students’ Union and is part of the biggest campus upgrade in a generation. It is the fruition of a successful and dynamic partnership that the University is proud to enjoy with its student body.

The new building is home to the University's Student Life services including support with study, health and wellbeing, preparing for the future, managing money and living in Cardiff. It will also increase links with the Students’ Union and enhance the services already provided there.

programs.description: Offering guidance on key dates and the personal statement, our 'UCAS and Applying to University' talk provides a useful insight into the application process.

programs.title: Open Day Exhibition
programs.description: Learn about the variety of support services and the exciting range of additional opportunities available at Cardiff University to enhance your student experience. Our drop-in advice stands give you the chance to ask our expert staff any questions that you may have. The Exhibition will include information on the following: Academic Study Skills and Mentoring, Applying to University (Admissions), City of Cardiff, Coleg Cymraeg Cenedlaethol, CUFoods - Catering, Global Opportunities, International Student Enquiries, Languages for All, MFL Mentoring, Residences (Accommodation), Residence Life, Sport, Student Disability Service, Student Funding and Advice and the University Library Service.
programs.description_short: Information stands for Open Day.

programs.title: Campus Tours
programs.description: Take a student-led walking tour around the Cathays Park Campus. Just a few minutes’ walk from the city centre, the majority of our academic schools can be found on our Cathays Park Campus, amongst the impressive buildings, parks and wide tree-lined avenues that form Cardiff’s attractive Civic Centre. Each tour lasts approximately 45 minutes. These tours are available throughout the day and the last tour will depart at 3.15pm.
programs.description_short: A tour around the Cathays Park Campus. Last tour departs at 3.15pm.
programs.room: Tours depart from Horseshoe Drive, Main Building  (Museum Avenue side of Main Building)

location.title: Bute Building
location.description:
This Grade II listed neoclassical building was designed by architects Percy Thomas and Ivor Jones, who won a competition in 1911 to design a building for Cardiff Technical College. The foundations of the building were laid in 1913 and the building opened in 1916. There are six Roman Doric columns in the front of the building.

location.title: Main Building (Park Place)
location.description:
Main Building - Architect W.D. Caroe sought to combine the charm and elegance of his former college (Trinity College, Cambridge) with the picturesque balance of many of the University of Oxford colleges. Building work on the Main Building commenced in 1905 and was completed in many stages, the first in 1909. Money ran short for this project, however, and although the side-wings were completed in the 1960s the planned Great Hall has never been built.

programs.title: Collect course information and meet staff and students
programs.description: Academic staff and current students will be available to answer your questions. Come and say hello!
programs.description_short: Come meet our academic staff and students to ask more about studying at Cardiff University.

location.title: Law and Politics Building
location.description:
Accessibility information
There is level access into the Law Building from Park Place and access from Museum Place is via a ramp with handrails or 5 steps with a handrail on the left hand side.

The reception is fitted with an induction loop for people with a hearing impairment. The lift services all floors, has a fold down seat for people with a mobility impairment, a mirror at the back and the levels are both audio and visually indicated.

There are accessible cubicles in the male (0.21) and female toilets (0.23) on the ground floor. There is an accessible gender-neutral toilet on the first floor (1.25A), which is around the corner from the lift.

programs.title: Why Study Law at Cardiff University?
programs.description: Find out more about studying Law at Cardiff University: an overview of the entry requirements, course content and structure.
programs.description_short: Learn more about studying Law at Cardiff University.

programs.description_short: Feel free to ask any questions.

location.title: Abacws Building
location.description:
Accessibility information

There is level access into Abacws from Senghennydd Road through the main entrance, and also from the rear of the building behind Cathays train station.

The lifts service all floors. Each lift has a mirror at the back and the levels are both audio and visually indicated.

There are two accessible cubicles on each floor. These are adjacent to each set of toilets.

Baby changing facilities are available in the Toilet for All on the ground floor.

Parking

There is street parking along Senghennydd Road, where blue badge holders can park free of charge.

Bicycle Parking

There are also freely available bicycle racks to the rear of the building next to the Cathays railway station ticket office.

Water refill locations:

2nd floor - North corridor
2nd floor - South corridor
3rd floor - North corridor
3rd floor - South corridor
4th floor - South corridor
5th floor - North corridor

programs.title: Tour of the School of Medicine (Heath Park Campus)
programs.description: Visit the School of Medicine at the Heath Park Campus to see our state-of-the-art facilities first-hand. Here, you will be able to take part in our clinical skills demonstrations, view our hi-tech simulation, explore our well-resourced Health Library, visit our information fair, and learn all about life as a Cardiff University medical student through a range of informal presentations. This tour will run throughout the day. See information on our shuttle bus routes and a map of Heath Park Campus. Don't forget to allow extra time to travel to activities at the Heath Park Campus.
programs.description_short: Visit the School of Medicine at the Heath Park Campus to see our state-of-the-art facilities first-hand.

location.title: Music Building
location.description: As you approach the School of Music, you can’t fail to notice the bronze sculpture on the lawn outside. We often get asked about this artwork so here’s a little background on it. The piece is called Three Obliques (Walk-In) and was created by the famed artist Dame Barbara Hepworth in 1968. Only two others exist, one at Chatsworth House, and one in Seattle. It’s an astonishing piece of sculpture and provides a lovely backdrop for our annual graduation photos!

programs.title: Physics and Astronomy at Cardiff University (2 hours)

Find out more about studying Physics and Astronomy at Cardiff University: an overview of the entry requirements, course content and structure.
Please note that whilst sessions in Physics and Astronomy last two hours (and include a talk, demo and tour), visitors are not obliged to stay for the whole session. Please see information on shuttle bus services, or the map for a walking route to the School.

location.title: Law and Politics Building
location.description:
Accessibility information
There is level access into the Law Building from Park Place and access from Museum Place is via a ramp with handrails or 5 steps with a handrail on the left hand side.

The reception is fitted with an induction loop for people with a hearing impairment. The lift services all floors, has a fold down seat for people with a mobility impairment, a mirror at the back and the levels are both audio and visually indicated.

There are accessible cubicles in the male (0.21) and female toilets (0.23) on the ground floor. There is an accessible gender-neutral toilet on the first floor (1.25A), which is around the corner from the lift.

topics.description: Both our courses are accredited by the British Psychological Society (BPS).

programs.title: Student Led Tour of Psychology Tower Building (20 mins)
programs.description: Current Students will guide you on a tour of rooms that they often use such as study spaces, computer rooms and lecture theatres. Please visit our Information Stand in the Psychology Foyer, Tower Building, for more information on tour availability. These tours will be available throughout the day.
programs.description_short: Student-led tour.

location.title: Tower Building
location.description:
The reception desk opposite the main entrance is fitted with an induction loop for people with hearing impairments. There are two lifts that service all floors in the Tower Building, however there is restricted access to the first and second floors. A key will be issued at reception to access these floors.

The Tower refectory is located on the ground floor, opposite the main entrance. There is a shop with a seating area and computers are available for internet access.

Accessible gender-neutral toilets are located on the ground and third floors. Toilet 0.06, on the ground floor is situated to the left of the main entrance, through the motorised double doors. The third floor toilet is room number 3.06.

programs.title: Tour of Centre for Artificial Intelligence, Robotics and Human-Machine Systems (IROHMS) (30 mins)
programs.description: Demos in our Centre for Artificial Intelligence, Robotics and Human-Machine Systems. There will be multiple timeslots throughout the day. Pre-booking on the day is essential as places are limited (6 people per tour). On arrival, please pick up your free ticket from our Information Stand in the Psychology Foyer, Tower Building. The tour will begin outside the IROHMS lab in the Psychology Foyer.
programs.description_short: Tour of IROHMS.

topics.name: Students' Union
topics.description: Our Students’ Union achieved second place in the WhatUni student choice awards for best Students' Union in 2024.

programs.title: Students' Union: Meet the Team (Heath Park Campus)
programs.description:
Join us at the Heath Park Campus Welcome Marquee and chat to our friendly staff. Learn about the wide range of activities and communities available to make your university experience unforgettable. Whether you're interested in societies, sports clubs, advice services, or finding job opportunities, we've got something for everyone. 

Don’t forget to allow extra time to travel to activities in Heath Park Campus. See information on our shuttle bus routes in the 'Getting around the University' section on the main page of the app.
programs.description_short: Come and chat to our friendly staff to find out more.

programs.title: Students' Union: Meet the Team (Cathays Park Campus)
programs.description: Join us at the Students' Union and chat to our friendly staff. topics.name: Residences
topics.description: Don’t forget to allow extra time to travel to visit the residences in Talybont. See information on our shuttle bus routes in the 'Getting around the University' section on the main page of the app.

programs.title: University Accommodation: Senghennydd Hall
programs.description:
The following accommodation is available for you to view today. If you would like to find out about our other accommodation options, please visit our Residences stand in the Open Day Exhibition or visit www.cardiff.ac.uk/residences                         
Senghennydd Hall  
•£169 per week for 2024/2025                     
•Part-catered, en-suite
• 5 minutes’ walk from Main Building 
• City centre location.         
Visits are available throughout the day and last entry will be at 15.45. The entrance is on Senghennydd Road.
programs.description_short: Come and view the accommodation available here at Cardiff University. Last entry is at 15.45.

location.title: Senghennydd Hall
location.description: Senghennydd Hall is a part catered residence situated within a very short distance of the Cathays Park campus and ideal for students studying Mathematics, Physics and Astronomy, Engineering or Computer Science. The evening meal service provides students with a hot meal Monday to Friday except during vacations. Generally the meals are served 17:00-20:00 at the nearby Trevithick Restaurant in the Queen's Buildings.

programs.title: University Accommodation: Talybont Court
programs.description:
The following accommodation is available for you to view today. If you would like to find out about our other University accommodation, please visit our Residences stand in the Open Day Exhibition or visit www.cardiff.ac.uk/residences.

Talybont Court 
•£153 per week for 2024/2025 
• Self-catered, en-suite 
• 15 minutes’ walk from Main Building 
• Shuttle bus available on Open Day (Route 1: departs from College Road)
• The communal area of an accessible flat is available to view on request only. Please speak to a member of staff at the residence for further details.

Visits are available throughout the day and last entry will be at 15.45. Please allow at least 45 minutes for the round trip including viewing. Please note: the Route 1 shuttle bus also stops at Talybont on its return journey from the Heath Park Campus.
programs.description_short: Come and view the accommodation available here at Cardiff University. Last entry is at 15.45.
programs.room: Buses depart from College Road, near the Temple of Peace (or 15 minutes on foot from Main Building)

location.title: Talybont Court
location.description: Talybont Court is part of the Talybont complex, which is the largest of the University’s residences and provides a range of social amenities including excellent sports facilities. This purpose-built development is situated close to large areas of parkland and is a short walk or cycle to most of the academic buildings.

location.title: Main Building (Park Place)
location.description:
Main Building - Architect W.D. Caroe sought to combine the charm and elegance of his former college (Trinity College, Cambridge) with the picturesque balance of many of the University of Oxford colleges. Building work on the Main Building commenced in 1905 and was completed in many stages, the first in 1909. Money ran short for this project, however, and although the side-wings were completed in the 1960s the planned Great Hall has never been built.

Water refill locations: 

Ground Floor  
- Room 0.91 North corridor 

1st Floor 
- Room 1.75 next to the male toilets
- Opposite Council Chamber near Library
- Inside the cafe
